title: The Outsider
creator_credit: Barry Washington and Country Education Project
brief_description: Richard McRoberts and Gary Kinnance begin the discussion with a brief survey of Albert Camus’ life and philosophy to set a background for a fuller treatment of the book. Specific passages are used as springboards for the analysis and explication of Camus’ themes. The meaning and place of “The Outsiders” as a piece of existential literature is discussed.
